Google prevzel Fitbit za 2,1 milijarde dolarjev!

02 Nov 2019, 07:40

Pametne zapestnice Fitbit so zelo koristne, če želimo spremljati naš napredek. Lahko tečemo cele dneve, a če nimamo »številk«, ki nam povedo, kako smo se odrezali, je težko ostati motiviran. S tem, ko spremljamo, koliko smo pretekli, koliko kalorij smo porabili in kakšen je naš povprečni srčni utrip, ostanemo navdušeni nad vadbo in se lažje držimo zadanih ciljev. To je tudi razlog, zakaj so pametne zapestnice Fitbit med aktivnimi uporabniki širom sveta še vedeno nadvse priljubljene.
Priljubljenost pametnih zapestnic Fitbit pa je verjetno razlog, zakaj so se pri podjetju Google odločili, da prevzamejo podjetje in s tem tudi zaposlene in njihove patente. Za ta nakup so pri podjetju Google segli globoko v žep, saj je prevzem vreden kar preračunanih 1,9 milijarde evrov oziroma 2,1 milijarde ameriških dolarjev. Pri podjetju Google so sicer priznali, da so za podjetje odšteti več, kot znaša njegova tržna vrednost, saj se ta giba okoli preračunanih 1,4 milijard evrov.
Strokovnjaki podjetji Google in Fitbit so v izjavi za javnost sporočili, da bodo kmalu pričeli z delom na novih izdelkih v domeni nosljivih pripomočkov in zdravstvenih pripomočkov. Poleg tega bodo skupaj razvijali Googlov operacijski sistem Wear OS in blagovno znamko Made by Google, pod katero bodo končnim uporabnikom na voljo prihodnje nosilne naprave. Podjetje Google po vsej verjetnosti ni imelo izkušenj pri oblikovanju strojne opreme, zato so v Fitbitu našli idealnega partnerja za to.
Sodelovanje pri razvoju novih izdelkov naj bi temeljilo na inovacijah, zasebnosti in skrbi za stranke. Google je namreč zatrdil, da bo manipulacija s podatki o zdravju in telesni pripravljenosti od začetka povsem pregledna in da te podatke ne bo uporabljal za postavljanje ciljanih oglasov. Uporabniki bodo imeli tudi pravico do pregleda in brisanja vseh svojih podatkov, ki jih zbirata Fitbit in Google. Poleg tega bo naprave Fitbit tudi v prihodnje mogoče uporabljati tako na napravah Android kot iOS.
Čeprav je finančna transakcija med podjetjema Google in Fitbit dogovorjena že sedaj, bo zaradi protimonopolnih vprašanj in potrebne po odobritvi s strani delničarjev obeh družb za popolno združitev treba počakati še nekaj časa. Združitev naj bi bila tako sklenjena v naslednjem letu.

text:
Google Acquires Fitbit for $ 2.1 Billion!

02 Nov 2019, 07:40

Fitbit smart bracelets are very useful to keep track of our progress. We can run all day, but unless we have "numbers" that tell us how we did, it's hard to stay motivated. By keeping track of how much we have passed, how many calories we have consumed, and what our average heart rate is, we remain excited about exercise and more easily set our goals. This is also why Fitbit smart bracelets are still widely popular among active users worldwide.
The popularity of Fitbit smart bracelets, however, is probably why Google has decided to take over the company and thus its employees and their patents. Google made a deep pocket for this purchase, with the acquisition worth as much as $ 1.9 billion or $ 2.1 billion, respectively. Google has admitted that more than its market value is deducted from the business, as it is around the estimated 1.4 billion euros.
Experts at Google and Fitbit said in a press release that they would soon begin work on new products in the wearable and health care domain. In addition, they will jointly develop Google's Wear OS and the Made by Google brand, under which future wearables will be available to end users. Google is unlikely to have had any hardware design experience, so Fitbit has found the ideal partner for it.
Participation in new product development should be based on innovation, privacy and customer care. Google has said that manipulation of health and fitness data will be completely transparent from the beginning and will not use that information to place targeted ads. Users will also have the right to view and delete all their data collected by Fitbit and Google. In addition, Fitbit devices can continue to be used on both Android and iOS devices.
Although a financial transaction between Google and Fitbit has already been agreed, the antitrust issues and the need for shareholder approval from both companies for a full merger will have to wait a while. The merger is expected to be concluded next year.
